name: Pharmacy/Treatment Route
description: The Pharmacy/Treatment Route segment (RXR) contains the alternative combination of route, site, administration device, and administration method that are prescribed as they apply to a particular order. The pharmacy, treatment staff and/or nursing staff has a choice between the routes. This segment is used with the RXO, RXE, RXD, RXG, and RXA segments to specify the route of administration for medications and treatments.

cardinality.note: Multiple RXR segments can be used to specify alternative routes

RXR.1.name: Route
RXR.1.description: This field contains the route by which the treatment is to be administered. Values from HL7 Table 0162 - route of administration.
RXR.1.generationHint: Most common routes: PO (50%), IV (20%), IM (10%), TOP (8%)

RXR.2.name: Administration Site
RXR.2.description: This field contains the body site where the medication or treatment is administered. Values from HL7 Table 0163 - body site.
RXR.2.generationHint: Use for injections - deltoid most common for vaccines, vastus lateralis for infants

RXR.3.name: Administration Device
RXR.3.description: This field identifies the mechanical device used to aid in the administration of the drug or other treatment. Values from HL7 Table 0164 - administration device.
RXR.3.generationHint: Common devices: SYR (syringes), IVP (IV pumps), MI (inhalers), NEB (nebulizers)

RXR.4.name: Administration Method
RXR.4.description: This field identifies the technique or method by which the treatment is administered. Values from HL7 Table 0165 - administration method.
RXR.4.generationHint: Common methods: IVCC (continuous), PUSH (IV push), BOLUS (one-time dose)

RXR.5.name: Routing Instruction
RXR.5.description: This field contains free text routing instructions that further clarify the administration route, site, device, or method.
RXR.5.generationHint: Free text instructions like 'Rotate injection sites', 'Administer slowly', 'With food'

notes: RXR segment can repeat to specify alternative routes for the same medication
Route (RXR.1) is required when RXR segment is present
Administration site is particularly important for injection routes
Multiple RXR segments allow flexibility in medication administration
Common in hospital settings where multiple administration options exist
Essential for proper medication administration documentation

conditional.RXR.2: Required for injection routes (IM, SC, IV)
conditional.RXR.3: Should be specified for complex administration methods
conditional.RXR.4: Important for IV medications and specialized techniques

relationships.RXR.1_RXR.2: Administration site should align with route (e.g., IM route needs injection site)
relationships.RXR.1_RXR.3: Device should be appropriate for route (e.g., IV pump for IV route)

validation.RXR.1: Must be valid HL7 Table 0162 route code
validation.RXR.2: Must be valid HL7 Table 0163 body site code when present
validation.RXR.3: Must be valid HL7 Table 0164 device code when present
validation.RXR.4: Must be valid HL7 Table 0165 method code when present
